snippet: A group of activists who set off a confrontation between China and Japan by sailing to disputed islands last month said Wednesday that a return trip was complicated by legal and financial barriers.
abstract: Group of activists who set off a confrontation between China and Japan by sailing to disputed islands in the East China Sea say that a return trip is complicated by legal and financial barriers; five uninhabited islands, which total a little over two square miles, are claimed by both countries.
lead_paragraph: A group of activists who set off a confrontation between China and Japan by sailing to disputed islands last month said Wednesday that a return trip was complicated by legal and financial barriers.

headline.seo: Activists Say Hong Kong Impedes Return to Disputed Islands
headline.main: Hong Kong Impedes Trip to Islands, Activists Say
headline.print_headline: Hong Kong Impedes Trip To Islands, Activists Say

keywords.value: Action Committee for Defending the Diaoyu Islands
